docs.title: 🧠 AI / ML Learnings
docs.text: Welcome to the AI & Machine Learning Knowledge Base! This documentation is a curated collection of topics, notes, and experiments that I've gathered while exploring the world of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

docs.title: 📌 Objectives
docs.text:
• Track and organize everything I learn in AI/ML.
  • Serve as a personal reference guide.
  • Help others who are starting out in the field.

docs.title: 🤖 Artificial Intelligence
docs.text:
• AI Fundamentals
  • Agents and Environments
  • Search Algorithms
  • Expert Systems

docs.title: 📈 Machine Learning
docs.text:
• Supervised vs Unsupervised Learning
  • Regression & Classification
  • Model Evaluation Metrics
  • Real-world ML Use Cases

docs.title: 🧮 Math for AI/ML
docs.text:
• Linear Algebra
  • Probability & Statistics
  • Calculus (Basics)
  • Optimization Techniques

docs.title: 📚 Projects & Practice
docs.text:
• Jupyter Notebooks
  • Hands-on Datasets
  • End-to-End ML Pipelines

docs.title: 🚀 Tools & Frameworks
docs.text:
• Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn)
  • TensorFlow / PyTorch
  • Jupyter Lab / Notebook
  • Google Colab

docs.title: 💡 Getting Started
docs.text:
If you're new to AI/ML, start with:

👉 ML Basics

docs.title: 🛠️ How This Site Was Built
docs.text:
• Built using MkDocs
  • Themed with Material for MkDocs
  • Content written in Markdown for simplicity and clarity

docs.title: 📬 Contributions & Feedback
docs.text:
This is a personal learning log, but feel free to suggest improvements or corrections on GitHub.

“The best way to learn is to teach.” ― Frank Oppenheimer

docs.title: Mkdocs-config
docs.text: Here’s a MkDocs configuration cheat sheet to help you quickly set up and customize your documentation project using the mkdocs.yml config file.

docs.title: 🔧 Basic Configuration (mkdocs.yml)
docs.text:
site_name: My Project Docs
site_url: https://example.com
site_description: Documentation for my AI/ML learning
site_author: Rishi

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - About: about.md
  - ML:
      - Basics: ml/basics.md
      - Models: ml/models.md
  - AI:
      - Concepts: ai/concepts.md
      - Tools: ai/tools.md

theme:
  name: material  # Recommended theme
  palette:
    primary: blue
    accent: indigo
  font:
    text: Roboto
    code: Roboto Mono

docs_dir: docs
site_dir: site

docs.title: 🧩 Common Extensions
docs.text:
markdown_extensions:
  - toc:
      permalink: true
  - admonition
  - codehilite:
      guess_lang: false
  - pymdownx.superfences
  - pymdownx.details
  - pymdownx.highlight
  - pymdownx.inlinehilite
  - pymdownx.emoji:
      emoji_generator: !!python/name:pymdownx.emoji.to_svg

Note

this is a note - admonition

Learn this
    ```python
    int a = 10
    ```

==highlight== or ==highlight==

docs.title: 🚀 Plugins
docs.text:
plugins:
  - search
  - mkdocstrings  # for API docs (e.g., Python)
  - git-revision-date

Install with: pip install mkdocs-material mkdocstrings mkdocs-git-revision-date-plugin

docs.title: 📁 Directory Structure
docs.text:
project/
├── docs/
│   ├── index.md
│   ├── about.md
│   └── ml/
│       └── basics.md
├── mkdocs.yml

docs.title: 🖼️ Extra Options (for Material theme)
docs.text:
extra:
  social:
    - icon: fontawesome/brands/github
      link: https://github.com/yourusername

docs.title: 📦 Deployment (GitHub Pages)
docs.text:
pip install mkdocs ghp-import
mkdocs build
ghp-import site
git push origin gh-pages

Or simpler with Material:

mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: 🌐 Serve Locally
docs.text: mkdocs serve

docs.title: What is Language Model?
docs.text:
• A language model is a machine learning model that aims to predict and generate plausible language. Autocomplete is a language model, for example.

  • These models work by estimating the probability of a token or sequence of tokens occurring within a longer sequence of tokens. Consider the following sentence:

When I hear rain on my roof, I _______ in my kitchen.

int a = 10
print(a)
